mlr3 v0.13.0

Dictionary of Performance Measures

Source: R/mlr_measures.R
mlr_measures.Rd

A simple mlr3misc::Dictionary storing objects of class Measure. Each measure has an associated help page, see mlr_measures_[id].

This dictionary can get populated with additional measures by add-on packages. E.g., mlr3proba adds survival measures and mlr3cluster adds cluster analysis measures.

For a more convenient way to retrieve and construct measures, see msr()/msrs().

Format

R6::R6Class object inheriting from mlr3misc::Dictionary.

Methods

See mlr3misc::Dictionary.

S3 methods

  • as.data.table(dict)
    mlr3misc::Dictionary -> data.table::data.table()
    Returns a data.table::data.table() with fields "key", "task_type", "predict_type", and "packages" as columns.

See also

Sugar functions: msr(), msrs()

Implementation of most measures: mlr3measures

Other Dictionary: mlr_learners, mlr_resamplings, mlr_task_generators, mlr_tasks

Other Measure: MeasureClassif, MeasureRegr, MeasureSimilarity, Measure, mlr_measures_aic, mlr_measures_bic, mlr_measures_classif.costs, mlr_measures_debug, mlr_measures_elapsed_time, mlr_measures_oob_error, mlr_measures_selected_features

Examples

as.data.table(mlr_measures)

#>                     key task_type     packages predict_type task_properties
#>  1:                 aic      <NA>                  response                
#>  2:                 bic      <NA>                  response                
#>  3:         classif.acc   classif mlr3measures     response                
#>  4:         classif.auc   classif mlr3measures         prob        twoclass
#>  5:        classif.bacc   classif mlr3measures     response                
#>  6:      classif.bbrier   classif mlr3measures         prob        twoclass
#>  7:          classif.ce   classif mlr3measures     response                
#>  8:       classif.costs   classif                  response                
#>  9:         classif.dor   classif mlr3measures     response        twoclass
#> 10:       classif.fbeta   classif mlr3measures     response        twoclass

#> 16:         classif.fpr   classif mlr3measures     response        twoclass

mlr_measures$get("classif.ce")

#> <MeasureClassifSimple:classif.ce>
#> * Packages: mlr3measures
#> * Range: [0, 1]
#> * Minimize: TRUE
#> * Parameters: list()
#> * Properties: -
#> * Predict type: response
msr("regr.mse")

#> <MeasureRegrSimple:regr.mse>
#> * Packages: mlr3measures
#> * Range: [0, Inf]
#> * Minimize: TRUE
#> * Parameters: list()
#> * Properties: -
#> * Predict type: response
